vulnerability_findings.name: locked-ether
vulnerability_findings.message:
Contract locking ether found in CentralLogger.sol:
	Contract CentralLogger has payable functions:
	 - fallback (CentralLogger.sol#267-272)
	But does not have a function to withdraw the ether

vulnerability_findings.name: external-function
vulnerability_findings.message: CentralLogger.fallback (CentralLogger.sol#267-272) should be declared external

vulnerability_findings.name: solc-version
vulnerability_findings.message:
Detected issues with version pragma in CentralLogger.sol:
	- pragma solidity0.4.23 (CentralLogger.sol#3): it allows old versions
	- pragma solidity0.4.23 (CentralLogger.sol#28): it allows old versions
	- pragma solidity0.4.23 (CentralLogger.sol#41): it allows old versions
	- pragma solidity0.4.23 (CentralLogger.sol#86): it allows old versions

vulnerability_findings.name: naming-convention
vulnerability_findings.message: Parameter '_registryAddress' of CentralLogger. (CentralLogger.sol#96) is not in mixedCase

vulnerability_findings.name: naming-convention
vulnerability_findings.message: Parameter '_amount' of CentralLogger.logPayoutEvent (CentralLogger.sol#192) is not in mixedCase

vulnerability_findings.name: naming-convention
vulnerability_findings.message: Parameter '_claimer' of CentralLogger.logClaimEvent (CentralLogger.sol#204) is not in mixedCase

vulnerability_findings.name: naming-convention
vulnerability_findings.message: Parameter '_payout' of CentralLogger.logClaimEvent (CentralLogger.sol#205) is not in mixedCase

vulnerability_findings.name: naming-convention
vulnerability_findings.message: Parameter '_oldAddress' of CentralLogger.logCustodianChangedEvent (CentralLogger.sol#225) is not in mixedCase

vulnerability_findings.name: naming-convention
vulnerability_findings.message: Parameter '_newAddress' of CentralLogger.logCustodianChangedEvent (CentralLogger.sol#226) is not in mixedCase

vulnerability_findings.name: naming-convention
vulnerability_findings.message: Parameter '_reclaimer' of CentralLogger.logReclaimEvent (CentralLogger.sol#239) is not in mixedCase

vulnerability_findings.name: naming-convention
vulnerability_findings.message: Parameter '_amount' of CentralLogger.logReclaimEvent (CentralLogger.sol#240) is not in mixedCase

vulnerability_findings.name: naming-convention
vulnerability_findings.message: Parameter '_upgradedFrom' of CentralLogger.logProxyUpgradedEvent (CentralLogger.sol#253) is not in mixedCase

vulnerability_findings.name: naming-convention
vulnerability_findings.message: Parameter '_upgradedTo' of CentralLogger.logProxyUpgradedEvent (CentralLogger.sol#254) is not in mixedCase

vulnerability_findings.name: naming-convention
vulnerability_findings.message: Constant 'CentralLogger.version' (CentralLogger.sol#91) is not in UPPER_CASE_WITH_UNDERSCORES

vulnerability_findings.name: External Call To User-Supplied Address (SWC 107)
vulnerability_findings.message:
A call to a user-supplied address is executed.
An external message call to an address specified by the caller is executed. Note that the callee account might contain arbitrary code and could re-enter any function within this contract. Reentering the contract in an intermediate state may lead to unexpected behaviour. Make sure that no state modifications are executed after this call and/or reentrancy guards are in place.
Classification: SWC-107

vulnerability_findings.name: External Call To User-Supplied Address (SWC 107)
vulnerability_findings.message:

Reentering the contract in an intermediate state may lead to unexpected behaviour. Make sure that no state modifications are executed after this call and/or reentrancy guards are in place.
Classification: SWC-107

vulnerability_findings.name: Multiple Calls in a Single Transaction (SWC 113)
vulnerability_findings.message:
Multiple calls are executed in the same transaction.
This call is executed following another call within the same transaction. It is possible that the call never gets executed if a prior call fails permanently. This might be caused intentionally by a malicious callee. If possible, refactor the code such that each transaction only executes one external call or make sure that all callees can be trusted (i.e. they’re part of your own codebase).
Classification: SWC-113
